DataElement.preferredName: Edmonton Frail Scale 6 Use Five or More Different Prescription Medications Regularly Score 2 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation about whether they used five or more different prescription medications on a regular basis, using a 2 point scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Edmonton Frail Scale Use Five or More Different Prescription Medications Regularly Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An assessment tool designed to be used by clinicians to assess the frailty of older patients. It assesses 10 domains including cognitive impairment and balance and mobility._A question about whether an individual did or does use five or more different prescription medications regularly._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An assessment tool designed to be used by clinicians to assess the frailty of older patients. It assesses 10 domains including cognitive impairment and balance and mobility.

Concepts.definition: An assessment tool designed to be used by clinicians to assess the frailty of older patients. It assesses 10 domains including cognitive impairment and balance and mobility.
